result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis J Hansen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Court's Response to 8-1-16 letter from DOC - Court takes no action. The JOC shows 40 days sentence credit on page 3 of 3. The questioned languange is simply an explanation of credit due upon revocation of probation that the 40 days is a total apportioned to each count. The "comment" is not reasonably read to grant the defendant "time served" in lieu of probation - Judge Wambach
from DOC requesting the JOC be amended
DNA Proof of Submission Form
with CCS and Elements

Cases 15CM495 & 15CM496 called together at 11:21 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Curtis J Hansen in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies Victim Rights Compliance Verified and submits victim impact statements, no further request to be heard - Court so finds.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1 & #2-15CM495 & Count #1-15CM496; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses remaining charges

On Counts #1 & #2-15CM495 & Count #1-15CM496, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months each count, with conditions as set forth on the criminal case settlement, which include:
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with recommended treatment per Agent
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--No presence in Pick N Save, Watertown
--No presence in Breslow's Family Market, Watertown
--Fine and/or costs
--DNA Sample and Surcharges
--Other Costs/Fees
--To pay restitution of $13.99 payable to Pick N Save (15CM496)
--To pay restitution of $13.69 payable to Breslow's Family Market (15CM495)
--pay $65 summons fees (15CM495)
--$2.77 restitution processing fee

Days credit for time already served: 20 days as to each count - both files

Court reviews appeal rights
Recess: 11:42 am

COVERS CASES 15CM495 & 15CM496
Jefferson County Jail

Commissioner Weber presiding for Branch II Intake: 

Cases 15CM495 and 15CM496 called together at 1:40pm
Defendant Curtis J Hansen appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann on behalf of Atty. Svehlek. 
Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Atty. Hagemann gives explanation for non appearance
Bond arguments given by Counsel

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

The Court requires a $350 CASH bond to cover both cases, with non monetary conditions as previously set.


recess 1:46  pm.
